metal.description: Metals: 355nm (UV for delicate), 1064nm (standard NIR), 10.6μm (CO2 for heavy cleaning)
metal.rationale: High absorption at 1064nm, UV for precision, CO2 for aggressive cleaning

ceramic.rationale: Ceramic absorption increases with wavelength, avoid UV damage

glass.rationale: Glass transparent to UV, moderate NIR absorption, strong CO2 absorption

plastic.rationale: UV excellent for organics, NIR safe, CO2 very effective but thermal

composite.rationale: Mixed materials need careful wavelength selection, avoid thermal CO2

wood.rationale: Organic material, UV very effective, NIR balanced, CO2 for heavy removal

stone.rationale: Natural materials, avoid UV to prevent discoloration, NIR/CO2 effective

masonry.rationale: Mixed cement/stone materials, avoid UV, NIR safe, CO2 for paint removal

semiconductor.rationale: High precision required, avoid thermal damage, shorter wavelengths preferred
